feed.title: SAP Community - SD (Sales and Distribution)
feed.subtitle: SD (Sales and Distribution) Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: value for withholding tax (TDS) for customer against sales order is not reflecting in F-28 Payments
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

I am facing an issue regarding withholding tax for customer through sales order.

The value of withholding tax is not fetching inF-28 withholding tax tab & system is showing zero as the value of withholding tax for Document type -RV.

I have successfully executed withholding tax for customer process from FI side but I am unable to process from sales.

Help me in resolving the issue

Regards,
Vaishnavi

entry.title: SD Flexible Workflow
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am currently working on a Flexible Workflow scenario for Sales Orders (SD) and I have a few questions:

  1. Sequential Approval Process

    • The business requirement is that one sales order should go through multiple approvals step by step ( Regional Approval → Finance Approval → Operations Approval → Final Approval).

    • If one approver rejects, the workflow should return back to the previous approver.

    • Is it possible to design this end-to-end approval chain within one workflow definition in Flexible Workflow, or do we need to trigger separate workflows one after another?

  2. Approval Visibility (Who Approved / Who is Pending)

    • Business users want to see clearly who already approved and whose approval is still pending for the same document.

    • Which Fiori app(s) or logs can provide this information? (My Inbox log, Workflow Instances, etc.)

  3. Approver Screen – Header vs. Item Details

    • Currently, in My Inbox, the approver only sees the header information of the sales order.

    •  

       

      • Is there a way to also display item-level details (line items) for better decision making?

      • Do we need to enhance the Flexible Workflow task UI with a custom extension?

  4. Navigation to VA03

    • When an approver opens the approval task in My Inbox, is it possible to provide a navigation option that directly opens the corresponding sales order in VA03 (Display Sales Order) in SAP GUI or via Fiori?

    • If yes, how can we configure or enhance the task to trigger this navigation?

Any guidance or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Incorrect scale level picked during final settlement for quantity-based rebate condition
entry.content:
Hello,

In a condition contract using condition type RES1 with Base Scale & condition table 163, we’ve maintained quantity-based scales for two materials: 

Material A: 1 PC = 1%, 5 PC = 2%, 10 PC = 3%

Material B: 20 PC = 2%, 30 PC = 4%, 40 PC = 6%

An invoice contains 7 PC of Material A & 32 PC of Material B. However, during  final settlement, the system incorrectly applies 3% for Material A & 6% for Material B. instead of the expected 2% & 4% resp.

This issue does not occur when only one condition record exists in the contract. Why is the system picking incorrect scale values when multiple condition records are maintained?

Thank you

entry.title: ARM Process Issue
entry.content:
Hi SAP Experts,

I’m facing an issue in our Advanced Returns Management (ARM) process where things are not working as expected when using the Replacement refund type in a return order.

What’s happening:

  • I’m creating a return order (type RE2) with refund type Replacement.

  • After the inspection step, the system is supposed to perform Logistical Follow-Up (for example, scrapping and creating a replacement order).

  • In some cases, this works fine.

  • But in other cases, the system tries to create a Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge (SD2) first instead of doing the logistical follow-up.

What’s strange:

  • When SD2 fails, the process stops and shows “Processed with errors”, but there’s no message in the application log (SLG1), and the replacement material checkbox becomes unchecked automatically.

  • Even though I didn’t expect an SD2 at this step, the system still tries to create one.

  • There is no difference in the materials, plant, or inspection lot type — some materials work fine in one case and fail in another.

  • We have only one plant, and this process does not involve a purchase order.

  • When I manually create SD2 using VA01 (with reference to RE2), it works perfectly.

  • Application log says, Follow up Document is still in Progress, MESSAGE 013.

What I need help with:

  • Why is the system trying to create SD2 before the logistical follow-up?

  • Is there a BAPI, BADI, or backend process controlling this that we should check?

  • Where can I find the logic that determines the sequence of steps (SD2 vs logistical follow-up)?

  • How can I prevent SD2 from being triggered when it’s not supposed to?

I’ve already checked logs in SLG1, SM13, and debugged a bit but couldn’t find the root cause.

Any help or direction would be appreciated!

entry.title: How to declare both quantity and billing percentage in SAP PS for SD billing?
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts,

I’m working on a BTP project using SAP PS and SD. The client wants to trigger SD billing from project milestones, which is a standard scenario. However, they also want to declare the actual quantity to be billed (e.g., 3 pallets of tiles, 5 bags of cement), not just rely on the milestone percentage.

In the standard milestone billing setup, the milestone only allows you to enter a percentage, which SAP then uses to calculate a partial billing quantity or value in SD.

Is there a standard way in SAP PS to declare both:

  • the milestone percentage (to track progress)

  • and the actual quantity to be billed (to reflect real physical work done)?

I've considered confirmation of activities (CNF) or material consumption (movement 261), but I'm looking for a way to integrate this directly into the milestone billing logic, or at least a standard-compatible workaround.

Any insights, configuration tips, or clarification on SAP standard limitations are very welcome.

Thank you!

entry.title: Advice Needed: Best Approach for Personas Dashboard for Sales Order & Credit Memo Creation (VA01)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently working on designing an SAP Screen Personas dashboard to streamline the sales order and credit memo creation process for our users. I’d really appreciate your insights on the best approach to take.

Here’s what I’m considering:

  • Option 1: Create a dashboard on SMEN (i.e. the SAP entry screen) with buttons that link to individual flavours:

    • One flavour for Create Sales Order
    • Another flavour for Create Credit Memo

    The idea is to navigate to the respective flavour when a button is clicked. However, I’m concerned about the URL dependency - as we transport flavours across the landscape, the URLs will change, and I’m unsure how to manage that dynamically.

  • Option 2: Build the dashboard directly on VA01, combining both processes into a single, large flavour. While this avoids the URL issue, I worry it might become difficult to maintain over time due to its complexity.

  • Option 3: Is there a better alternative I haven’t considered?

Has anyone tackled a similar scenario? I’d love to hear how you approached it, especially regarding navigation between flavours, maintainability, and landscape transport considerations.

Thanks in advance for your advice!

entry.title: How schedule line dates and quantities are calculated in sales order?
entry.content:
Hi Experts and Gurus,

I have went through many blogs and articles and still could not get a clear idea on how schedule line dates and quantities are calculated in sales order.

Can anybody explain the full scenario of how schedule lines are calculated in sales order? Which all are the places the data is fetched from (such as material master, MRP etc.)

 

 

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Coping Price from Inquiry to Quotation in Public cloud
entry.content:
Hello experts,

When I try to create Quotation referencing Inquiry, the Unit price from Inquiry isn't coping to Quotation. Also in Copy control configuration of Inquiry to Quotation the Pricing type field is in display mode in Public cloud. Any solutions for this scenario ?

entry.title: Syntactically incompatible change of existing functionality error.
entry.content:
Hi,

In my custom code i am using the below BAPI.
Everything works fine but i get the error message which you can see in the header of the question, in ATC.
I  went through the snotes but didn't help me. (2438131, 2215852 ) 
How can i get over this issue?
Here is the BAPI.

  METHOD /bobf/if_frw_action~execute.
    TYPES: BEGIN OF lty_delivery_all,
             key     TYPE /bobf/conf_key,
             ref_doc TYPE vgbel,
           END OF lty_delivery_all.

    DATA: lt_items_all    TYPE TABLE OF /scmtms/s_tor_item_tr_k,
          lv_action_key   TYPE /bobf/conf_key,
          lt_mod          TYPE /bobf/t_frw_modification,
          ls_mod          TYPE /bobf/s_frw_modification,
          lr_action_par   TYPE REF TO /bobf/s_atf_a_create_file,
          lr_atf_root     TYPE REF TO /bobf/s_atf_root_k,
          ls_parameters   TYPE /bobf/s_atf_a_create_file,
          lt_return       TYPE TABLE OF bapiret1,
          lt_success      TYPE TABLE OF bapivbrksuccess,
          lt_delivery_all TYPE TABLE OF lty_delivery_all,
          lv_pdf          TYPE fpcontent,
          lv_destination  TYPE rfc_dest. 

    CONSTANTS: lc_x           TYPE c                       VALUE 'X',
               lc_c           TYPE c                       VALUE 'C',
               lc_ordbilltyp  TYPE fkara                   VALUE 'Z01',
               lc_ref_doc_ca  TYPE c LENGTH 1              VALUE 'K',
               lc_kschl       TYPE na_kschl                VALUE 'ZMRT',
               lc_name_prefix TYPE c LENGTH 17             VALUE 'Test',
               lc_mime_code   TYPE w3conttype              VALUE 'application/pdf',
               lc_att_type    TYPE /bobf/attachment_type   VALUE 'ATCMT',
               lc_att_schema  TYPE /bobf/attachment_schema VALUE 'DEFAULT'.

    "Get items to be able to reach delivery numbers.
    io_read->retrieve_by_association(
      EXPORTING
        iv_node        = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_node-root
        it_key         = it_key
        iv_association = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_association-root-item_tr
        iv_fill_data   = abap_true
      IMPORTING
        et_data        = lt_items_all ).

    "Prepare delivery table for all FOs.
    LOOP AT lt_items_all ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_item>) WHERE base_btd_id IS NOT INITIAL AND base_btd_tco = '73'.
      APPEND INITIAL LINE TO lt_delivery_all ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_delivery_all>).

      <ls_delivery_all>-key = <ls_item>-parent_key.
      SHIFT <ls_item>-base_btd_id LEFT DELETING LEADING '0'.
      <ls_delivery_all>-ref_doc = |{ <ls_item>-base_btd_id  ALPHA = IN }|.
    ENDLOOP.

    "Prepare data to be able to check if invoice generation should be blocked or not.
    IF lt_delivery_all IS NOT INITIAL.
      SELECT tknum,tpnum,vbeln
        FROM vttp INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_vttp)
        FOR ALL ENTRIES IN @LT_delivery_all
        WHERE vbeln = @LT_delivery_all-ref_doc.

      IF sy-subrc = 0 AND  lt_vttp IS NOT INITIAL.
        SELECT vbeln,faksk,lifsk,spstg
          FROM likp INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_likp)
          FOR ALL ENTRIES IN @LT_vttp
          WHERE vbeln = @LT_vttp-vbeln.

        IF sy-subrc = 0 AND lt_likp IS NOT INITIAL.
          SELECT vbeln,posnr,faksp,vgbel,vgpos,vgtyp
            FROM lips INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_lips)
            FOR ALL ENTRIES IN @LT_likp
            WHERE vbeln = @LT_likp-vbeln.

          IF sy-subrc = 0.
            SORT lt_lips BY vbeln posnr.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.

    "Generate attachments one by one for the selected FOs.
    LOOP AT it_key ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_key>).

      "Prepare delivery table for the current FO.
      DATA(lt_delivery) = VALUE bapivbrk_t( FOR ls_del IN lt_delivery_all WHERE ( key = <ls_key>-key ) ( ordbilltyp = lc_ordbilltyp
                                                                                                         ref_doc_ca = lc_ref_doc_ca
           	                                                                                             ref_doc    = ls_del-ref_doc  ) ).
      "Stop GAI creation in case preceding docs have blocks.
      IF lt_delivery IS NOT INITIAL.
        LOOP AT lt_delivery ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_delivery>).
          IF VALUE #( lt_likp[ vbeln = <ls_delivery>-ref_doc faksk = lc_x ]      OPTIONAL ) IS NOT INITIAL.
            DELETE lt_delivery WHERE ref_doc = <ls_delivery>-ref_doc.
          ELSEIF VALUE #( lt_likp[ vbeln =  <ls_delivery>-ref_doc lifsk = lc_x ] OPTIONAL ) IS NOT INITIAL.
            DELETE lt_delivery WHERE ref_doc = <ls_delivery>-ref_doc.
          ELSEIF VALUE #( lt_likp[ vbeln =  <ls_delivery>-ref_doc spstg = lc_x ] OPTIONAL ) IS NOT INITIAL.
            DELETE lt_delivery WHERE ref_doc = <ls_delivery>-ref_doc.
          ELSEIF VALUE #( lt_lips[ vbeln =  <ls_delivery>-ref_doc faksp = lc_x ] OPTIONAL ) IS NOT INITIAL.
            DELETE lt_delivery WHERE ref_doc = <ls_delivery>-ref_doc.
          ELSEIF VALUE #( lt_lips[ vgbel =  <ls_delivery>-ref_doc vgtyp = lc_c ] OPTIONAL ) IS NOT INITIAL.
            DELETE lt_delivery WHERE ref_doc = <ls_delivery>-ref_doc.
          ENDIF.
        ENDLOOP.
      ELSE.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.

      "Create invoice.
      CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_BILLINGDOC_CREATEMULTIPLE' DESTINATION lv_destination
        TABLES
          billingdatain = lt_delivery
          return        = lt_return
          success       = lt_success. "(Not optional!)

      CLEAR: lt_delivery.

      "Using the invoice number do the attachment.
      LOOP AT lt_return ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_return>).

        IF <ls_return>-type NE if_cwd_constants=>c_message_success.
          MESSAGE ID <ls_return>-id TYPE <ls_return>-type NUMBER <ls_return>-number WITH <ls_return>-message_v1 <ls_return>-message_v2 INTO lv_dummy.
          /scmtms/cl_msg_helper=>msg_helper_add_symsg( CHANGING co_message = eo_message ).
          CONTINUE.
        ENDIF.

        "Wait up to 5 seconds until the billing document is ready.
        DO 5 TIMES.
          WAIT UP TO 1 SECONDS.

          cl_o2c_bil_services=>get_print_preview(
            EXPORTING
              iv_vbeln   = CONV #( <ls_return>-message_v1 )
              iv_kschl   = lc_kschl
            IMPORTING
              ev_pdf     =  lv_pdf
              es_message = DATA(ls_msg) ).

          IF lv_pdf IS NOT INITIAL.
            EXIT.
          ENDIF.
        ENDDO.

        IF lv_pdf IS INITIAL.
          MESSAGE ID ls_msg-msgid TYPE ls_msg-msgty NUMBER ls_msg-msgno WITH ls_msg-msgv1 ls_msg-msgv2 INTO lv_dummy.
          /scmtms/cl_msg_helper=>msg_helper_add_symsg( CHANGING co_message = eo_message ).
          CONTINUE.
        ENDIF.

        "Check if there is already an attachment.
        io_read->retrieve_by_association(
          EXPORTING
            iv_node        = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_node-attachmentfolder
            it_key         = VALUE #( ( key = <ls_key>-key ) )
            iv_association = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_association-root-attachmentfolder
          IMPORTING
            et_target_key  = DATA(lt_atf_key)  ).

        "If this is the first attachment, then first create an attachment node.
        IF lt_atf_key[] IS INITIAL.
          CREATE DATA lr_atf_root.
          lr_atf_root->key        = /bobf/cl_frw_factory=>get_new_key( ).
          lr_atf_root->parent_key = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_node-root.
          ls_mod-change_mode      = /bobf/if_frw_c=>sc_modify_create.
          ls_mod-association      = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_association-root-attachmentfolder.
          ls_mod-source_node      = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_node-root.
          ls_mod-node             = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_node-attachmentfolder.
          ls_mod-source_key       = <ls_key>-key.
          ls_mod-key              = lr_atf_root->key.
          ls_mod-data             = lr_atf_root.
          INSERT ls_mod INTO TABLE lt_mod.

          io_modify->do_modify( EXPORTING it_modification = lt_mod ).
          INSERT VALUE #( key = lr_atf_root->key ) INTO TABLE lt_atf_key.
        ENDIF.

        "Fill the parameter table
        CREATE DATA lr_action_par.
        GET REFERENCE OF ls_parameters INTO lr_action_par.
        ls_parameters-alternative_name          = lc_name_prefix && <ls_return>-message_v1.
        ls_parameters-content                   = lv_pdf.
        ls_parameters-file_name                 = lc_name_prefix && <ls_return>-message_v1.
        ls_parameters-mime_code                 = lc_mime_code.
        ls_parameters-name                      = lc_name_prefix && <ls_return>-message_v1.
        ls_parameters-description_language_code = sy-langu.
        ls_parameters-description               = lc_name_prefix && <ls_return>-message_v1.
        ls_parameters-description_content       = lc_name_prefix && <ls_return>-message_v1.
        ls_parameters-visibility_type           = abap_true.
        ls_parameters-attachment_type           = lc_att_type.
        ls_parameters-attachment_schema         = lc_att_schema.

        "Get action key for creating attachment.
        IF lv_action_key IS INITIAL.
          /scmtms/cl_common_helper=>get_do_keys_4_action(
            EXPORTING
              iv_host_bo_key      = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_bo_key
              iv_host_do_node_key = /scmtms/if_tor_c=>sc_node-attachmentfolder
              iv_do_action_key    = /bobf/if_attachment_folder_c=>sc_action-root-create_file
            IMPORTING
              ev_action_key       = lv_action_key ).
        ENDIF.

        "Attach geberated PDF.
        io_modify->do_action(
          EXPORTING
            iv_act_key    = lv_action_key
            it_key        = lt_atf_key
            is_parameters = lr_action_par
          IMPORTING
            et_failed_key = DATA(lt_failed_key_atf) ).

        "Get tor id.
        DATA(lv_tor_id) = /scmtms/cl_tor_helper_root=>return_id_fortor_key( EXPORTING iv_tor_key = <ls_key>-key ).

        "Clear for the next round.
        CLEAR: ls_parameters, lt_atf_key, lr_action_par.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.

 Here is the ATC message.

Regards

entry.title: how to correct condition amount in closed sales order in sap
entry.content: The order is invoiced. How to correct the condition amount. I have corrected the condition amount and access sequence but without deleting the invoices, can we correct the tax amount in the BP credit segment?

entry.title: SD: Rounding differences in invoicing
entry.content:
When invoicing an SD order with the following conditions:

For 6 pieces at 35,000.00 Euro each, a 9% percentage surcharge is configured. SAP correctly calculates this surcharge to be 3,150.00 Euro per piece.

However, this only occurs once you navigate to the header conditions.
However, during the invoicing process, the system calculates a surcharge of 3,149.98 Euro, resulting in a 2-cent rounding difference.

Bei der Fakturierung eines SD-Auftrages mit folgenden Konditionen:

6 Stück zu 35.000,00 Euro wird ein prozentualer Zuschlag von 9% hinterlegt und SAP ermittelt korrekt einen Zuschlag von 3.150,00 Euro pro Stück.
Bei der Fakturierung wird dann allerdings ein Zuschlag von3.149,98 ermittelt und 2 Cent werden als Rundungsdifferenz ausgewiesen. 

Dies geschieht allerdings erst, wenn man einmal in die Kopfkonditionen wechselt.

entry.title: we need to deactived the ForTrade/Customs label which in the billing Header
entry.content:
we need to deactived the ForTrade/Customs label which in  the billing Header.we tried some salution in 

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/foreign-trade-in-export-invoice/qaa-p/8669594#M2818402

Go to IMG -> SD -> Foreign trade / customs -> Control foreign trade data in MM and SD documents -> Foreign trade data in MM and SD documents.

Please mail me necessary step to deactivate FT.

AND we didn't need this service,how should we do can not display the label

entry.title: When we do print preview getting file corrupted on billing document.
entry.content: When we do a print preview getting file corrupted on billing document.

entry.title: Sharing PO Responsibilities Between Two Company Codes (GR & Cost Split)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm exploring a business requirement involving two company codes and would appreciate your insights:

  • Company Code 1 creates a Purchase Order to a supplier.

  • Company Code 2 receives the goods (Goods Receipt) against that PO.

  • Company Code 1 is responsible for paying the material cost.

  • Company Code 2 is responsible for paying the customs/duties related to the import.

My current approach:

  • Company Code 1 issues the PO to the supplier,

  • Then an Intercompany STO is created from Company Code 1 to Company Code 2 (Free of Charge),

  • Company Code 2 receives the goods via the STO.

However, this adds complexity and time to the process.

Question:
Is there any alternative or simplified solution in SAP S/4HANA that allows:

  • Company Code 1 to issue the PO,

  • Company Code 2 to post the Goods Receipt directly against that PO,

  • And each company code to handle their respective costs (material vs. customs)?

We would appreciate any advice on configurations, custom enhancements, or standard processes that might help here.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: S4 Public cloud - invoice and cancelled invoice are still open
entry.content:
Hi,

We have situation by having invoice and cancelled invoice are still open in document flow and "to be posted" status in manage billing documents app but new invoice is cleared and status is correct as completed with accounting doc also. We found that the invoice and cancelled invoice which are not posted to acc due to item number mismatch (Ex: SO item no. is 10 and invoice item no. is 11). new invoice is having item no.10 as per SO. Since the new invoice is posted to acc and no issue but in process flow we have incorrect status and in document flow also we have open status. 

Can anyone help on this.

Regards,

Rajesh

entry.title: Sales Order - Return VA01
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I have a question I can't seem to resolve, and I haven't been able to for days.

We have a condition for a sale return due to a customer's rejection. We're setting up the ZBDE condition, and everything went well, except for the incorrect CNPJ on the invoice. The current CNPJ is the company's, but it should be the customer's CNPJ. Do you know what causes the customer's CNPJ to be entered in the STCD1 field of the invoice?

Thank you for your support

best regards,
Israel Ramos

entry.title: Incorrect Pricing Condition Assigned During EDI Sales Order Creation via SAP_COM_0223
entry.content:
Hello experts, 

I am creating a sales order via EDI using the SAP_COM_0223 communication arrangement (scope item 2EL) in SAP S/4 Public Cloud .

The sales order is created, but we've noticed an issue with the pricing conditions: the system is assigning the ZPS0 condition record, which is typically used for intercompany pricing.

However, for EDI-based sales orders, the correct pricing condition should be ZPR0. Could you help us understand why ZPS0 is being picked up instead of ZPR0, and what configuration we should review to ensure ZPR0 is applied correctly?

Here is Part of the payload sent via EDI:

<E1EDP01 SEGMENT="1">
<POSEX>10</POSEX>
<ACTION>001</ACTION>
<PSTYP>0</PSTYP>
<MENGE>120</MENGE>
<MENEE>MTK</MENEE>
<VPREI>19.7</VPREI>
<PEINH>1</PEINH>
<E1EDP02 SEGMENT="1">
<QUALF>044</QUALF>
<BELNR>APCDA012324176_SL404</BELNR>
</E1EDP02>
<E1EDP19 SEGMENT="1">
<QUALF>003</QUALF>
<IDTNR>5414995372915</IDTNR>
</E1EDP19>
<E1EDPT1 SEGMENT="1">
<TDID>Z001</TDID>
<E1EDPT2 SEGMENT="1">
<TDLINE>KUDOS Gris moyen</TDLINE>
</E1EDPT2>
</E1EDPT1>
</E1EDP01>

Thank you in advance!

Kind regards

Safa

entry.title: Criação de POs via requisição duplicando devido grupo de compras diferente.
entry.content:
Olá,

Após a aplicação do S4 SP10, as POs passaram a 'splitar' conforme o grupo de compras.

Antes da aplicação dessa nota, isso não ocorria, mesmo os itens sendo de grupos de compras diferentes, a PO era gerada, conforme o grupo de compras do primeiro item (informação que ia no cabeçalho). 

Identificamos esse KBA (https://me.sap.com/notes/3171484/en), segundo ele esse split pode ser configurado via customizing.

  • "Whether line items have the same purchase group value (can be disabled via customization)"

Mas não encontramos qual o caminho no SPRO para desativar esse split, alguém já passou por isso?

Obrigado!

entry.title: Need Clarification on the Role of SAP CS in the Context of SAP PM, Given the Presence of SAP SD
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I’m currently working with SAP PM and came across the SAP CS module. From what I understand, SAP SD already handles customer-related sales processes.

My question is:

  • In a PM context, when and why would we use SAP CS instead of (or in addition to) SAP SD?

  • Are there scenarios where CS is essential for handling customer-related service processes that SD alone cannot cover?

I’d appreciate insights, real examples, or references from your experience to better understand the necessity and added value of SAP CS in this context.

Thanks in advance for your guidance!
